alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central Phoenix; Deer Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Northwest Valley; Rio Verde, Salt River; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 3:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa County through 400 PM MST... At 326 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow boundaries from thunderstorms along a line extending from near Horseshoe Reservoir to near Peoria to 13 miles southwest of Morristown. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Scottsdale, Peoria, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Fountain Hills, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Youngtown, Waddell, Laveen, Cashion, Sun City, Wittmann, Sugarloaf Mountain and New River. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 98 and 150. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 233. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
